item.title: Hijacked Microsoft Stream classic domain "spams" SharePoint sites
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The legacy domain for Microsoft Stream was hijacked to show a fake Amazon site promoting a Thailand casino, causing all SharePoint sites with old embedded videos to display it as spam. [...]

item.title: Infostealer campaign compromises 10 npm packages, targets devs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Ten npm packages were suddenly updated with malicious code yesterday to steal environment variables and other sensitive data from developers' systems. [...]

item.title: Chinese FamousSparrow hackers deploy upgraded malware in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A China-linked cyberespionage group known as 'FamousSparrow' was observed using a new modular version of its signature backdoor 'SparrowDoor' against a US-based trade organization. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5053656 update released with 38 changes and fixes
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​​Microsoft has released the KB5053656 preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2 with 38 changes, including real-time translation on AMD and Intel-powered Copilot+ PCs and fixes for authentication and blue-screen issues. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: New Windows scheduled task will launch Office apps faster
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​In May, Microsoft plans to roll out a new Windows scheduled task that launches automatically to help Microsoft Office apps load faster. [...]

item.title: The 4 WordPress flaws hackers targeted the most in Q1 2025
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new report sheds light on the most targeted WordPress plugin vulnerabilities hackers used in the first quarter of 2025 to compromise sites. [...]

item.title: Mozilla warns Windows users of critical Firefox sandbox escape flaw
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Mozilla has released Firefox 136.0.4 to patch a critical security vulnerability that can let attackers escape the web browser's sandbox on Windows systems. [...]

item.title: WhatsApp's Meta AI is now rolling out in Europe, and it can't be turned off
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: You can't escape Meta AI in WhatsApp even if you are based in one of the 41 European countries, with the feature now rolling out to more devices. [...]

item.title: Recent Windows Server 2025 updates cause Remote Desktop freezes
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft says a known issue is causing Remote Desktop freezes on Windows Server 2025 systems after installing security updates released since the February 2025 Patch Tuesday. [...]

item.title: Vivaldi integrates Proton VPN into the browser to fight web tracking
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Vivaldi has announced the integration of Proton VPN directly into its browser without requiring add-on downloads or plugin activations, allowing users to protect their data against 'Big Tech' surveillance for free. [...]

item.title: Dozens of solar inverter flaws could be exploited to attack power grids
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: Dozens of vulnerabilities in products from three leading makers of solar inverters, Sungrow, Growatt, and SMA, could be exploited to control devices or execute code remotely on the vendor's cloud platform. [...]

item.title: UK fines software provider £3.07 million for 2022 ransomware breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The UK Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) has fined Advanced Computer Software Group Ltd £3.07 million over a 2022 ransomware attack that exposed the sensitive personal data of 79,404 people, including National Health Service (NHS) patients. [...]

item.title: Oracle customers confirm data stolen in alleged cloud breach is valid
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Despite Oracle denying a breach of its Oracle Cloud federated SSO login servers and the theft of account data for 6 million people, BleepingComputer has confirmed with multiple companies that associated data samples shared by the threat actor are valid. [...]
